intro: Delostoma loxense, commonly known as the yellow bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms. The plant is typically found in slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. Its simple morphology includes branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. Delostoma loxense plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to the food web through its prey-trapping mechanism.
